item.title: Games That Let You Be A Powerful Shapeshifter
item.description:
There's something thrilling about letting go of a fixed form and becoming something far more dangerous. Games that let players shapeshift offer a power fantasy that truly goes beyond mere strength or speed. They invite fans to slip into new skin, wield abilities no ordinary character could, and see the world from a fresh perspective.

Some of these titles turn players into monstrous predators, others into divine warriors, and a few even let them blend perfectly into their surroundings before striking. These games revel in transformation, and make the act of shifting shape feel central to their worlds.

Prototype

Becoming the Apex Predator

Prototype
8.9 /10
Released
June 9, 2009

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
m
Developer(s)
Radical Entertainment
Powered by

Prototype gives players the power trip of a lifetime, putting them in the shoes of Alex Mercer, a man infected with a mutagen that essentially turns his entire body into a weapon. His shapeshifting isn't just cosmetic. It lets him sprout claws or massive hammers, absorb enemies to steal their appearance, and even leap across entire city blocks. The game’s story involves a conspiracy-filled dive into bioweapon warfare and corporate secrets.

But it’s the feeling of becoming unstoppable that makes this game so memorable. Mercer isn't just strong; he’s almost godlike, mowing down military squads one minute and taking out tanks the next. Few games make players feel as untouchable as this one does when its shapeshifting is fully unleashed.

Carrion

The Monster In The Vents

Carrion
8 /10
9.0 /10
Released
July 23, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
m
Developer(s)
Phobia Studios
Powered by

Few games manage to flip the horror script quite like Carrion . Players control a writhing, many-mouthed creature breaking out of a secret facility, slithering through vents, and devouring terrified scientists. Each new biomass upgrade lets the creature shift size and unleash new abilities.

What makes it special is how the shapeshifting isn't just about combat, but also movement and puzzle-solving. Shrinking to fit through narrow tunnels or growing into a mass of teeth and tentacles keeps the game wonderfully dynamic. By the time players are tearing through security squads with ease, the game has delivered on its promise of letting them be the horror.

Altered Beast (2005)

Classic Transformation With A Twist

Altered Beast
Beat 'Em Up
Action
Horror
Systems
Released
January 27, 2005
ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ // Fantasy Violence
Developer(s)
Sega

Powered by

The 2005 reboot of Altered Beast brought the arcade classic into 3D and leaned even harder into shapeshifting. Players become a member of a military experiment who can turn into a werewolf, a dragon, or even an aquatic mutant, each with distinct playstyles.

The transformations are the highlight here, often triggered mid-combat to turn the tide of battle in brutal fashion. The game also has a darker tone than its original counterpart, with a story about genetic experimentation gone wrong. While the reboot wasn’t universally loved, its commitment to letting players swap forms as often as possible kept the action interesting.

Bayonetta

Stylish Witch, Endless Forms

Bayonetta
8 /10
8.0 /10
Released
October 29, 2009

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Partial Nudity, Strong Language, Suggestive Themes
Developer(s)
Platinum Games
Powered by

Bayonetta may be known for her dazzling combos and that whole angel-slaying spectacle, but her shapeshifting abilities are equally iconic. Mid-combo, she can transform into a panther to sprint across battlefields or a bird to glide through the air.

Her Witch Time mechanic already slows enemies to a crawl, but combining it with her transformations gives her unmatched fluidity. The shapeshifting also extends outside of combat, making traversal feel just as flashy as the fights. It’s about turning every fight into a dance of constant transformation.

Primal

Becoming The Guardians

Primal
Action-Adventure
Horror
Systems
Released
March 25, 2003

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
m
Developer(s)
SCE Studio Cambridge
Powered by

In Primal , players step into the shoes of Jen Tate, a woman pulled into a parallel dimension and gifted the ability to take on the forms of four guardian races. Each form has its own strengths, weaknesses, and abilities that affect both combat and exploration.

The game’s focus on using the right form at the right time gives it a puzzle-like rhythm. Switching from a lava-resistant Djinn form to a winged Wraith form isn't just cool, it’s necessary to progress. This makes the shapeshifting feel like an integral part of the journey rather than just a flashy gimmick.

Castlevania: Lords of Shadow 2

Dracula Unleashed

Castlevania: Lords of Shadow 2
6 /10
8.0 /10
Released
February 25, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
m
Developer(s)
MercurySteam
Powered by

Castlevania: Lords of Shadow 2 finally lets players take full control of Dracula himself, and his shapeshifting powers are as brutal as expected. He can transform into a swarm of bats to evade attacks, a mist to slip through gates, or even a dragon for devastating finishers.

The ability to freely switch between these forms mid-combat creates some of the most stylish battles in the series. Outside of fights, the transformations are used for clever traversal and stealth segments. It’s an example of shapeshifting being tied to both narrative and mechanics, truly focusing on Dracula’s status as a legendary force of darkness.

Prey

Become The Coffee Mug

Arkane Studios’ Prey might be best remembered for its eerie Art Deco space station setting. But its Mimic Matter ability deserves its own special place in all-time great video game powers. Players take control of Morgan Yu, who is trapped on a station that's been completely overrun by shape-shifting aliens called Mimics.

After she manages to unlock their own alien abilities, she can turn their own trick right back on them. Players can turn into anything from a humble office chair to a life-saving turret and use this bizarre power to sneak past enemies, solve environmental puzzles, or set up the perfect, paranoid ambush. It's empowering, and wonderfully mischievous.

item.title: How to Get ALL Scooby-Doo Skins in Fortnite
item.description:
Fortnite x Scooby-Doo brings the entire Mystery Inc. crew (minus Scrappy-Doo) into the Battle Royale, where they're going to have to use their skills as fighters more so than their skills as detectives. Solving mysteries might be the aim of Mystery Inc., but they're going to have to take a break to get some dubs in Fortnite . Below is a look at every Scooby-Doo character that's coming to Fortnite thanks to Fortnitemares 2025, what items they come with, when they release, and how much they cost.

How to Get Scooby-Doo in Fortnite

  • Scooby-Doo Item Shop Link
  • Scooby-Doo costs 1,500 V-Bucks and is available in the Item Shop until November 1, 7:59 PM ET.

Ruh-roh! Scooby-Doo gets on his hind legs in order to join the Battle Royale experience, and he's even wearing a skeleton onesie to keep himself warm in the chillingly spooky season of Fortnitemares. Scooby-Doo can be purchased on Saturday, October 11, at the Item Shop reset at 8 PM ET. Scooby-Doo only comes with the onesie and the same onesie in a toon style, so there's no chance that players can let Scoob fight in just his regular appearance.

Just like Shaggy, Scooby loves his food, which is why he can also get the Scooberoni Pizza Back Bling, and the Bone 'N Bowl Pickaxe. Here's how much each item costs:

  • Scooberoni Pizza back bling - 300 V-Bucks
  • Bone 'N Bowl pickaxe - 800 V-Bucks

How to Get Shaggy Rogers in Fortnite

  • Shaggy Item Shop Link
  • Shaggy costs 1,500 V-Bucks and is available in the Item Shop until November 1, 7:59 PM ET.

Zoinks! It's time for Shaggy to leave behind his love of Scooby Snacks and sandwiches to drop from the Battle Bus in search of a Victory Royale. Joined by his best bud Scoob, players can grab Shaggy from the Item Shop on Saturday, October 11. Shaggy comes with two styles: a Fortnite -unique version and a toon version, which is cel-shaded.

Shaggy's love of food comes to his set, as players can get Shaggy's Super Sandwich Back Bling, which grows in size with each elimination. Shaggy also gets the Hoagie Hitter Pickaxe, furthering his love of food. However, these items are sold separately - here's how much they cost:

  • Shaggy's Super Sandwich back bling - 600 V-Bucks
  • Hoagie Hitter pickaxe - 800 V-Bucks

As part of the Shaggy and Scooby items, players can also get Shaggy's Special emote for 300 V-Bucks, the Green Ghost glider for 1,200 V-Bucks, the Scooby Gang Run emote for 500 V-Bucks, and the What's New Scooby-Doo jam track by Simple Plan for 500 V-Bucks.

In total, all these cosmetics would cost 8,000 V-Bucks. Therefore, players who want to get all of them might want to consider obtaining the Shaggy & Scooby bundle, which is sold at a discount price of 3,400 V-Bucks. Here are all the included items:

How to Get the Mystery Machine in Fortnite

  • The Mystery Machine will release on Tuesday, October 14, at 8 PM ET.
  • Price: Unconfirmed, but should be around 1,800 V-Bucks.

The Mystery Machine brings forth the iconic 4-seater for the whole Scooby Gang to enjoy as they investigate the Battle Royale island. The Mystery Machine replaces the SUV in your loadout, but sadly, its only style is cel-shaded, so it might stand out a bit more than usual.

The prices and items for the following skins are not yet known, but we'll provide an update as soon as we can.

How to Get Velma Dinkley in Fortnite

  • Velma will be released in the Item Shop on Saturday, October 18, at 8 PM ET.
  • Price: TBC

The Mystery Inc. group needs Velma to function, as she's the brains of the organization. The team's greatest sleuth, Velma, is usually the one to uncover the mystery and solve the crimes before Shaggy and Scooby can even get their second sandwich of the night. Velma's wit and genius make her valuable to the team, so make sure you have a Velma when you're running squads.

How to Get Daphne Blake in Fortnite

  • Daphne will be released in the Item Shop on Saturday, October 18, at 8 PM ET.
  • Price: TBC

If there's anything Daphne loves more than Fred and mysteries, it's fashion, and Fortnite is the perfect place for her to try on new shoes thanks to the Kicks found in the Item Shop. Daphne gets into danger pretty easily, so whoever tends to fight squads on their own should definitely equip the Daphne skin for when you're running squads.

How to Get Fred Jones in Fortnite

  • Fred will be released in the Item Shop on Saturday, October 18, at 8 PM ET.
  • Price: TBC

The leader of the Mystery Inc. gang, and the designated driver of the group, is Fred Jones. Fred loves traps, mysteries, and following a strict no-no rule of Battle Royale with his investigation techniques to "split up". Fred might not want to split up after dropping from the Battle Bus, unless he intends to play solos.

297
8.9 /10

Fortnite

item.title: How Starseeker: Astroneer Expeditions Is Rethinking Live-Service Games Without FOMO
item.description:
Starseeker: Astroneer Expeditions is a significant departure from the base-building space survival game that preceded it. Along with a shift toward a session-based extraction shooter-style gameplay loop, Starseeker is also adopting a live-service model to deliver fresh content and gameplay twists regularly. It's an ambitious move that may inspire fears of the typical live-service pain points: FOMO, microtransactions, and aggressive player-retention strategies that keep players engaged for longer than they might like. Thankfully, System Era has shown a commitment to avoiding those aspects of the model.

In an interview with Game Rant, System Era co-founder and Starseeker creative director Adam Bromell spoke passionately about handling the game's live-service implementation in an ethical manner that's considerate of both players and developers. Essentially, Starseeker aims to leverage the best features of a live-service model while shooing away the aspects that don't align with the team's prosocial mission.

Starseeker Doesn't Mind If You Can't Always Play

Fans of live-service games often struggle with numerous titles vying for their attention, either through FOMO or game mechanics that can punish players for failing to check in regularly. Recently, this was highlighted by Dune: Awakening , where players must log in periodically to pay taxes and maintain their generators, or they could potentially lose tens of hours of progress. Refreshingly, Bromell says that he often considers ways to handle a live-service game that doesn't punish players—directly or indirectly—for the amount of time they can put into the game:

“It’s technically a live-service game. We want continuous support so we can sustain ourselves and our players, but we want to do it in a way that doesn’t stress players out. I play a lot of live-service games, and I think about: can we be the kind where it doesn’t matter if you give us two hours a month, a week, or a day? Play how you want. It’s a sandbox—we give you agency from the very first UX beats.”

The live-service model can appeal to players with limited playtime as long as they aren't made to feel like they're missing out, turning what should be a meaningful experience into a weekly to-do list item to check off. By removing the pressure to play routinely and the consequences for failing to do so, players with limited time might actually be more keen to revisit Starseeker when they have a chance.

How Starseeker Avoids FOMO

FOMO is a difficult problem to tackle for live-service games, as their evolving nature means players may inevitably miss out on limited-time events and content. One way Bromell hopes to alleviate this is by 'unvaulting' previous seasonal content from time to time. While this ensures that players who missed out the first time have another chance to experience the content, it also makes the workload manageable for System Era. Rather than needing to work excessive hours or greatly expand the team, the Starseeker team can work at a more comfortable pace, which tends to benefit players with higher-quality content at the same time. Bromell says:

That means avoiding FOMO. We literally had a meeting about the ‘Disney Vault.’ I’d love to be on Season 5 and bring the Season 3 planets ‘out of the vault’ so players can come back and complete those stickers. If you missed it, maybe it returns. Also, I don’t want to grind my team into a pulp. I don’t want to balloon from 60 people to 600. I want us to sustain players’ interest and respect their time and money ethically—and let our folks work sane hours.”

So far, Starseeker sounds like a breath of fresh air among the countless live-service games that take a more heavy-handed approach to player retention. For gamers who enjoy the idea of an ever-evolving title but find it difficult to remain committed, System Era's upcoming co-op game might be the answer.

STARSEEKER: Astroneer Expeditions

Follow
Followed
Action
Adventure

Developer(s)
System Era Softworks

item.title: All Nile Guard Collectibles in Battlefield 6
item.description:
Nile Guard is the seventh mission in Battlefield 6 's Campaign, and players will play as Mul Ibrahim Al-Khatib . The mission is one of the smallest in the game, and the objective is to eliminate Pax using the armored division of Egypt . Players can also complete two challenges in this mission, which are " Mission Complete 2 " and " Campaign - Nile Guard ".

The rewards for these challenges are Standard Issue ( NATO Character ) and Canopy Drop ( Vehicle Camo ), respectively. However, to complete the second challenge, players must find all the Dog Tags , and their locations in Battlefield 6 are listed in the guide below.

Dog Tags are picked up with E on PC, X on Xbox, and Square on PlayStation. They also shine, making them easier to spot. When picked up, they will display a soldier's name and date of birth.

Dog Tag 1 in 'Nile Guard' Mission in Battlefield 6

  • Saied Zaher (Egyptian Ground Forces - 26 May 04)

After the Tank section, you will have to exit the vehicle and go forward on foot. Proceed into the building, and as you come out of the building, ignore the path on the left, which is the main objective, and look to your right to spot a tree with the Dog Tag lying right next to it.

Dog Tag 2 in 'Nile Guard' Mission in Battlefield 6

  • Hassan Taha (Egyptian Ground Forces - 25 AUG 96)

The second collectible is not far away from the first one. After going through the previously mentioned right path, you will come out into an open area where the helicopter is close to you, but the area is filled with enemies. Deal with them first, but do not go to the heli just yet . This is because this will initiate a cutscene, causing you to miss out on the collectible .

Instead, look to the northeast to spot a building with a few blue chairs out front and a blue umbrella to the right. Head inside the building to find the Dog Tag stuck on the wall next to the posters.

In the case you went ahead to the heli, your mission will end after the cutscene, but you can still replay the mission at any time. Plus, the mission is barely 15 minutes long, so it should not take you long to get back to the end of the mission.

Players interested in finding out how long to beat Battlefield 6 can ​​​​​​check out the guide here.

9.1 /10
9 /10

Battlefield 6

item.title: Grow a Garden: Best Pets Tier List
item.description:
With Roblox 's Grow a Garden animal update, the devs have really stepped up the game by adding a ton of fun new content. Now, besides growing fruits and taking care of your garden, you can also have some pets, just like Pet Simulator 99 . These animals aren't just a cute addition to your farm; they also boost your crops and improve your player experience in some pretty cool ways.

Some pets will make your fruits and veggies mutate, while others will make them bigger or even give you free fruits and seeds. To get them, though, you’ll need to buy and hatch their eggs, which can cost a lot of Sheckles. So, it’s important to know which animals are worth it. If you’re looking to spend wisely, here's a ranking of the animals in Grow a Garden from least to most valuable .

Updated on October 11, 2025, by Somiya Adrees: The tier list below in this guide has been refreshed to include every pet available up to the 1.27.0 update, including all the time-limited pets as well; this should help players decide which pets to keep, trade, or let go.

Grow a Garden: All Pets Tier List

Currently, Grow a Garden is home to 174 animals, each with its own unique abilities. Think of them as walking gear. They can do stuff like turn your crops into mutated ones, water your plants, speed up sprinklers, or even search out free seeds for you.

You can only have three animals active in your garden at a time (unless you've snagged more pet slots), but the good news is that any extras you hatch won’t go to waste. You can swap them in and out whenever you like for a fresh vibe or to enjoy their different perks. Here’s a simple tier list of all the animals in Grow a Garden , with reasons why some are more useful than others:

All Animals

Tier Ranking

Type

Reasoning

Kitsune

S Tier

Fruit-Stealing Pet

Right now, the best pet in Grow a Garden. It can apply a Chakra Mutation (15x value) to a fruit from a nearby garden , or even a Foxfire Chakra (90x value), and give it to you.

Raccoon

S Tier

Fruit-Stealing Pet

Gives free fruit every 15 minutes by cloning one from a neighbor’s garden .

Disco Bee

S Tier

Mutation Pet

Activates the Disco mutation on crops (125x value) nearly every 20 minutes, with a 12.28% chance each time.

Dragonfly

S Tier

Variant Pet

Gives a guaranteed Gold plant every five minutes (worth 20x more). It's hard to say no to that.

Corrupted Kitsune

S Tier

Mutation Pet

Turns nine fruits in your garden into either Corrupt Chakra (15x value) or Corrupt Foxfire Chakra (90x value) variants.

Chinchilla

S Tier

Ability Cloner

Better than the Mimic Octopus, as it lets the critter perform another pet’s ability three times within 40 minutes (saves 20 minutes compared to the Mimic Octopus).

Headless Horseman

S Tier

Mutation Pet

Resets Level 50 pets to Level 1 and applies one of four mutations: Dreadbound (6 to 30 XP/s), Soulflame (gives XP to pets or adds Burnt/Flaming mutation to plants), Spectral (1.08x faster critter cooldown), or Nightmare (125% bigger pet size or 1.22x faster cooldown).

Butterfly

S Tier

Variant Pet

Applies Rainbow mutation (50x) to plants with five mutations every 30 minutes (skips favorited ones).

Mimic Octopus

S Tier

Ability Cloner

Mimics the ability of an active pet . Best when paired with other S-tier animals.

Swan

S Tier

Ability Cloner & Mutation Pet

Works like the Mimic Octopus but copies a pet ability from a neighbor’s farm. Also applies the Graceful Mutation to plants.

Cockatrice

S Tier

Multiple Traits

A multi-talented critter that adds Gold and Silver variants to your plants. It can also do one of three things at a time: hatch eggs faster, give crops Toxic Mutation (15x), or help pets earn more Experience Points.

French Fry Ferret

S Tier

Aging Pet

Best critter for aging pets, as it grants 1 level to a random pet every 20 minutes to an hour. Great for farming pet age to trigger mutations.

Spinosaurus

S Tier

Mutation Pet

Eats one mutation from four plants and puts them all on a single fruit , preferring to bless one of your favorited plants.

T-Rex

S Tier

Mutation Pet

Eats a mutation from a random fruit grown on your farmland and then pours it onto three to four different fruits .

Fennec Fox

S Tier

Mutation Pet

Copies the most valuable mutation from a plant in your neighbor's garden and applies it to one of your crops.

Space Squirrel

S Tier

Mutation Pet

Forces the previously admin-special Voidtouched Mutation (135x multiplier) onto your plants.

Brontosaurus

S Tier

Size Booster

It’s the first animal that can give you big pets by adding a size and weight bonus to hatched eggs.

Golden Goose

S Tier

Mutation Pet

Lays a Golden Egg, which is actually a plant with the Fortune Mutation (50x multiplier). Selling this egg-like crop might pass the Fortune Mutation to one of the fruits in your garden.

Griffin

S Tier

Mutation Pet & Cooldown Pet

Comes with two abilities: triggers Cyclonic mutation (50x) and shortens pet cooldowns by 67 seconds on contact.

Koi

S Tier

Egg Giver

May return the eggs you hatch while they’re swimming around your plot.

Luminous Sprite

S Tier

Mutation Pet

Lets you obtain Luminous mutated fruits worth 50x.

Lemon Lion

S Tier

Mutation Pet & XP Booster

Forces Brainrot Mutation (100x) on fruits and adds XP to a random pet’s bar.

Seal

S Tier

Egg Giver

Can give you the egg of a pet you just sold , meaning you can keep selling unwanted Mythicals and Divines for Mythical and Bug Eggs to try for your desired pets.

Queen Bee

S Tier

Cooldown & Mutation

Great as a support critter for Raccoon, Red Fox, Disco Bee, and more, since it fully resets a random pet’s ability cooldown . Also applies the Pollinated mutation (3x value) to a nearby crop roughly every 25 minutes.

Blood Kiwi

S Tier

Hatch Related

Can greatly reduce your eggs' hatch time (by 45 seconds per minute) and increase hatch speed by 20%.

Lobster Thermidor

S Tier

Mutation Pet

Applies Molten (25x value) or the admin-special Meteoric (125x) mutation to a plant in your garden.

Praying Mantis

S Tier

Variant Pet

Triggers either a Gold or Rainbow mutation on fruits, boosting their value. Definitely a must-have if you're aiming for higher stacking bonuses.

Pancake Mole

S Tier

Resource Pet

Can find Sheckles, all types of Sprinklers (including Mater and Grandmaster ), Trowel, Recall Wrench, Harvest Tool, Lightning Rod, and Watering Can.

Bone Dog

S Tier

Seed Pet

Better than the Shiba Inu and Golden Lab, this critter can dig up seeds from the Seed Shop, including special ones like the Great Pumpkin Seed .

Shiba Inu

S Tier

Seed Pet

More chance to find a free seed than Golden Lab. Improve its ability by giving it Gold or Rainbow pet mutations.

Blood Owl

S Tier

XP Booster

Makes all your active pets age faster .

Firefly

S Tier

Mutation Pet

Turns nearby plants Shocked (100x multiplier) every 80 seconds, with a 3% chance.

Mizuchi

S Tier

Mutation Pet

Grants Azure mutation (75x) to plants. When you sell those plants, there’s a chance a random mutation from the fruit will reapply to another plant.

Ghost Bear

S Tier

Mutation Pet

A must-have animal for the Ghoul Garden event, since it forces Spooky mutation on your plants , which are required to trade with the Jack-o-Lantern NPC for Candy Corn event currency.

Spider

A Tier

Cooldown & Plant Growth

Weaves a web for 10.21 seconds that increases pets’ ability cooldown by 1.02s per second and makes fruits mature faster. Its Mega or Titanic versions can cover a large area of your garden and be super beneficial.

Pumpkin Rat

A Tier

Cosmetic Pet

If you place Pumpkins (Simple or Evo) in your garden, this animal will turn them into Jack-O-Lantern event cosmetics .

Reaper

A Tier

Cooldown and XP Booster

A good pet for giving more XP or lowering ability timers for active pets in exchange for four fruits. It simply works as a Medium Treat and Medium Toy , but the 20-minute cooldown and single-critter use keep it from being S-tier.

Tiger

A Tier

Multiple Traits

Grants 5,186 total XP to all critters on your farm and swaps three random mutations for three new ones in your garden.

Chicken Zombie

A Tier

Mutation Pet

Grants your fruits the Zombified Mutation (25x multiplier).

Dilophosaurus

A Tier

XP Booster

Gives 608 XP to 3 to 4 random pets so they age quicker or use their traits a bit sooner (like 41 seconds early).

Chubby Chipmunk

A Tier

Aging & Resource Pet

Gains weight over time and also rewards you with event lanterns and gear shop items .

Idol Chipmunk

A Tier

XP Booster

Fills 1.48% of all pets’ hunger bars per second every 12 minutes (the percentage increases as the chipmunk ages). It’s extremely good for keeping critters fed .

Red Fox

A Tier

Seed Pet

Steals (duplicates) a plant seed from a neighbor’s farm (Seed Shop ones only).

Triceratops

A Tier

Plant Growth Pet

Literally the best pet to use if you want multiple plants to grow fruits quickly .

Fortune Squirrel

A Tier

Mutation Pet

Forces the admin-reserved Jackpot mutation to plants with a 15x multiplier.

Red Panda

A Tier

Restock Pet

Can go to either the Gear Shop, Seed Shop, or Pet Shop to restock one random item. This critter's ability can't be mimicked.

Sugar Glider

A Tier

Mutation Pet

Unlike Spinosaurus, which consumes the mutations from plants, this one just copies mutations from three plants and applies them to each other.

Marmot

A Tier

Resource Pet

Plays hide and seek with you, rewarding Fall-type items if caught. It also has a 15 to 30% chance of doing it again.

Phoenix

A Tier

Multiple Traits

When pets are processed in the mutation machine, they come out aged up to 4 years. Additionally, the critter grants a 20% chance to apply Flaming Mutation (25x) to four fruits in your garden.

Moon Cat

A Tier

Fruit Size Booster & Harvest Related

Boosts fruit size (1.51x) and keeps Lunar and Blood Moon plants from disappearing after harvest (with only a 6.1% chance).

Ostrich

A Tier

Aging Pet

Lets your hatched pets come with an age of one to four.

Peach Wasp

A Tier

Mutation Pet

Adds the once admin-only Plasma Mutation to fruits and pushes forward a random pet’s cooldown.

Mole

A Tier

Resource Pet

Can dig up free gear for you every 80 seconds (i.e., Sprinklers, Lightning Rod, Trowel) and also Sheckles.

Apple Gazelle

A Tier

Multiple Traits

Applies Warped Mutation (75x) to apple-type fruits when picked up and also duplicates them .

Sand Snake

A Tier

Resource Pet

Clone tools from the Gear Shop (like Sprinklers, Tanning Mirrors, Magnifying Glass, and more) and seeds from the Seed Shop when making a purchase, meaning you might get two instead of one with a 1.45% chance.

Capybara

A Tier

XP Booster

Critters within its radar won’t lose hunger and will gain XP every second instead.

Golem

A Tier

Speed-Up Pet

If you’re mutating a pet, it goes to the Mutation Machine every 6.35 minutes and cuts its timer by 42.42 seconds.

Axolotl

A Tier

Harvest Related

Best for making Sheckles, as it gives you a 6.54% chance for summer fruits to stay on their plants . Most of those are top-tier, like Traveler’s Fruit, Lily of the Valley, and Guanabana, so you can collect more of them when harvesting.

Petal Bee

A Tier

Multiple Traits

Ideal for farming Pollinated Fruits (Queen Bee-like timer) and keeping flowers after harvest , especially high-value ones like Sunflower, Moon Blossom, Purple Dahlia, and Pink Lily.

Pachycephalosaurus

A Tier

Resource Pet

When crafting items, it may grant you a bonus item of the same kind.

Tanchozuru

A Tier

Mutation Pet

Adds the Tranquil mutation (20x value) to all crop types in your garden.

Cooked Owl

A Tier

Mutation Pet

Can give your crops the Burnt (4x value) or Cooked (25x value) mutation roughly every 15 minutes, with a 15.28% chance to activate. Also grants active animals an extra 0.17 experience points.

Sushi Bear

A Tier

Mutation Pet

Offers better odds of triggering Frozen (10x value) or Chilled (2x value) mutations than a Polar Bear (15%) and can also feed pets to keep them full.

Raiju

A Tier

Mutation Pet

Removes the Shocked mutation from a fruit and applies the Static (8x value) mutation to four fruits in your garden. During thunderstorms, it may apply the Shocked mutation instead of Static. Favorited fruits are ignored.

Spaghetti Sloth

A Tier

Mutation Pet

Blesses plants with either Sauce (3x value), Meatball (3x value), or Pasta (4x value) every 3 to 14 minutes. Combining all three grants the Spaghetti (15x value) mutation.

Spriggan

A Tier

Mutation Pet

This critter has a 15.21% chance to apply the Bloom mutation (8x value) to nearby plants.

Sea Turtle

A Tier

Mutation & XP Booster

Sends about 1,000 XP to a random pet every 11 minutes and makes a fruit Wet (2x value).

Tree Frog

A Tier

Plant Growth Pet

Like Triceratops, it speeds up a plant’s growth every three minutes for a total of 15 minutes.

Blood Hedgehog

A Tier

Plant Growth & Variant

Best if you have lots of prickly fruits (i.e., Durian, Cactus, Dragon Fruit, and Pineapple) on your farm, as this critter can make them larger and increase their chances of getting Gold and Rainbow variants.

Tarantula Hawk

A Tier

Cooldown & Mutation

Similar to Queen Bee , but only advances pet cooldown by 1.3 minutes. Useful if you haven’t unlocked Queen Bee yet.

Starfish

A Tier

XP Booster

A situational critter that gains 6.36 XP every second . Best used when you're trying to unlock extra pet slots. It's even better than any Brown Mouse, as it can earn you 3,816 experience points every 10 minutes.

Golden Lab

A Tier

Seed Pet

Digs up random seeds ( Common to Prismatic) . Perfect for farming while you're AFK.

Snail

A Tier

Seed Pet

Can sometimes give you a seed from the plant you just harvested .

Turtle

A Tier

Sprinkler Pet

Mainly works with sprinklers, making them last longer .

Night Owl

A Tier

XP Booster

Has the same ability as Blood Owl but isn’t as good.

Echo Frog

A Tier

Plant Growth Pet

Speeds up a random plant’s growth by a full day every 10 minutes.

Hamster

A Tier

Speed-Up Pet

Handy for crafting, as it boosts your crafting speed by 30.45% for 18.74 seconds every 3.05 minutes.

Black Cat

B Tier

Fruit Size Booster

Similar to the Moon Cat, it enlarges fruit size but isn’t as strong because of its low timer and smaller size bonus. It also needs a Witch's Cauldron to work.

Wolf

B Tier

Multiple Traits

Triggers the Moonlit mutation (2x multiplier) and transforms your avatar into a werewolf for a short time , increasing movement speed and jump height.

Bat

B Tier

Variant Pet

Blesses your Spooky Plants (purchased from the Halloween Market) with a 0.7% chance to grow Gold or Rainbow variants . The ability works within a 32-stud radius of the bat.

Silver Dragonfly

B Tier

Variant Pet

Adds a Silver mutation (variant) to plants, but it’s weaker compared to Dragonfly or Butterfly since its multiplier is the lowest.

Hyrax

B Tier

Seed Pet

Gives you a rare Fissure Berry seed (worth 13k shekels per berry) by eating around your garden.

Hummingbird

B Tier

Seed Pet

Converts single-harvest plants into seeds every minute (including some limited seeds), except for favorited ones.

Mallard

B Tier

Resource Pet

Gifts the player with a random gear item and then returns to the player's inventory.

Barn Owl

B Tier

XP and Pet Size

All pets from the Fall update earn extra XP per second while roaming your farm if the Barn Owl is active. It also gives a weight bonus to pets bought from the shops.

Chipmunk

B Tier

Resource Pet

Has a small chance to not consume one of the Harvest Tool’s uses, which is really useful.

Red Squirrel

B Tier

Cooldown Pet

Makes Fall-type pets use their abilities quicker.

Imp

B Tier

Resource Pet

Plays a catch game with you, and if you grab it, you get rewards like gear and event items . Sometimes it even gives you Grandmaster Sprinklers.

Wisp

B Tier

XP Booster

Allows all active pets in your garden to 0.77 gain experience points per second , but only if a Wisp Well is placed.

Drake

B Tier

Speed-Up Pet

Cuts cooking time by 11% as it breathes fire beneath the pot.

Ankylosaurus

B Tier

Resource Pet

Might return stolen plants to your inventory while it’s active.

Tanuki

B Tier

Multiple Traits

Messes around in your garden by adding mutations like Choc (2x), Chilled (2x), Moonlit (2x) and more to one of your fruits; it may also grant Sheckles , age itself, or do other activities.

Bald Eagle

B Tier

Hatch Related

Lets you hatch eggs 70.40 seconds faster every 7 minutes, not as good as Blood Kiwi, though.

Gnome

B Tier

Mutation Pet

Applies the Gnomed Mutation (15x) and adds a 1.05% extra chance to force it if Gnomed-type cosmetics are placed in your plot.

Junkbot

B Tier

Mutation Pet

Forces the Oil mutation (15x multiplier) on a random plant (14.52% chance).

Mandrake

B Tier

Mutation Pet

While active in your garden, there is a 3% chance to apply Rot Mutation (8x) to a random fruit.

Grizzly Bear

B Tier

Mutation and Player Size Pet

It forces Fall Mutation on plants. Also, makes your avatar bigger , which looks pretty fun.

Gorilla Chef

B Tier

Cooking Pet

It has a good chance of giving you two meals instead of one when cooking.

Hyacinth Macaw

B Tier

Mutation Pet

Like the Cloudtouched Mutation Spray, it gives your crops the Cloudtouched Mutation (6x multiplier) every eight minutes, though the probability is only 15.74%.

Bear Bee

B Tier

Mutation Pet

Acts just like a Honey Sprinkler, granting a confirmed HoneyGlazed mutation (5x value) to fruits every 25 minutes.

Badger

B Tier

Mutation Pet

The first critter that lets you trigger the Cracked Mutation (4x) even outside Earthquake weather.

Polar Bear

B Tier

Mutation Pet

Has a 10.12% chance to grant you a Chilled or Frozen fruit every 1.49 minutes.

Pterodactyl

B Tier

Jump Height & Mutation

Increases your character’s jump height and flaps its wings to give three to four fruits the Windstruck Mutation (2x Value), and sometimes even the Twisted Mutation (5x Value).

Scarlet Macaw

B Tier

Mutation Pet

Has a chance to bless a nearby fruit with a Verdant mutation (4x value) every 11.51 minutes, though the chance is only 15.95%.

Red Giant Ant

B Tier

Harvest Related

Can copy your plants when you pick them (even Divine ones).

Bacon Pig

B Tier

Variant Pet

Same as the Pig, it raises the odds of nearby plants growing as Gold or Rainbow variants , though it takes a bit longer to activate in comparison.

Kiwi

B Tier

Hatch Related

A weaker version of Blood Kiwi (helps lower hatching time to 20 seconds per minute).

Sunny-Side Chicken

B Tier

Hatch Related

Useful for hatching, as it increases hatch speed by 20.27%.

Silver Monkey

B Tier

Resource Pet

When you sell fruit, it might pop back into your inventory (even mutated ones like Shocked, Gold, or Rainbow). The rarer it is, the lower the chance.

Football

B Tier

Resource Pet

You can get Sheckles or a Watering Can by running around the related shops.

Kappa

B Tier

Mutation Pet

Waters your plants to give them the Wet mutation (2x value), or alternatively transforms Wet fruits into Bloodlit (5x value).

Spotted Deer

B Tier

Fruit Duplicator

Can duplicate your berry plants (Celestiberries, Grapes, Strawberries, Blueberries, Cranberries) with a 5% chance.

Blue Jay

B Tier

Plant Growth Pet

Makes berry plants grow 1.55x faster , which is especially useful during events that require submitting berry crops.

Farmer Chipmunk

B Tier

Plant Growth Pet

Speeds up the growth of nutty plants such as Acorn, Hazelnut, Acorn Squash, and Coconut, making them mature 1.56x faster.

Deer

B Tier

Fruit Duplicator

A variant of the Spotted Deer with lower odds of cloning berry plants , but still handy in the Fall Update.

Parasaurolophus

B Tier

Speed-Up Pet

Mostly helps you open up the cosmetic crates faster.

Raptor

B Tier

Mutation Pet and Movement Booster

Has a small chance to trigger the Amber Mutation (10x value) on harvested fruits and also boosts walking speed by 14%.

Seedling

B Tier

Mutation Pet

Lets you swap mutations between two plants , so you can farm mutations on your best ones. Thankfully, it ignores favorited plants.

Stegosaurus

B Tier

Fruit Duplicator

Lets you snag a bonus fruit when picking plants . Prehistoric crops have better odds than other rare ones. It’s super useful when harvesting a Bone Blossom plant.

Moth

B Tier

Aging Pet

Keeps your pets' Hunger Bar full every 13 minutes, helping them age faster and perform better (Variant pets can give higher-tier mutations, and seed diggers can find better seeds.)

Honey Bee

B Tier

Mutation Pet

Lets you farm guaranteed Pollinated plants (3x multiplier) faster than other bees. Aging it can reduce the timer.

Mochi Mouse

B Tier

XP Booster

Can grant 510 XP to itself and a small amount of XP per second to food-type critters like French Fry Ferret, Spaghetti Sloth, Sushi Beet, etc.

Hotdog Daschund

B Tier

Cooldown and XP Booster

Can give experience points or advance a pet’s cooldown every 3.57 minutes with a 20% chance.

Meerkat

B Tier

Cooldown Pet

A critter that can lower another pet’s cooldown by 21.08 seconds every 7.14 minutes. Sometimes, it might even perform its ability again instantly after one round.

Pig

B Tier

Variant Pet

Has a higher chance of granting Gold and Rainbow variants than the Praying Mantis (2.2% every two minutes), but its cooldown is longer in comparison. It’s a decent pick, though not as rewarding as the Mantis.

Giant Ant

B Tier

Harvest Related

Not as strong as Red Giant Ant , but it's still useful.

Dog

B Tier

Seed Pet

It’s like a low-key version of a Golden Lab.

Orangutan

B Tier

Resource Pet

It comes in handy when crafting often, as it offers a 3.43% chance to return materials to your backpack.

Crab

B Tier

Resource Pet

Only manages to snatch around 260 to 460 Sheckles every 6 minutes.

Brown Mouse

B Tier

Jump Height & XP Booster

Good for unlocking more pet slots since it ages fast (803.74 XP/10 min) and also boosts player jump height .

Panda

B Tier

Crop Value Booster

Bamboo is a solid money plant, and Panda increases its price even more.

Wasp

B Tier

Cooldown & Mutation

Shares the same abilities as Queen Bee and Tarantula Hawk, but has a weaker ability timer.

Dairy Cow

B Tier

Plant Growth & Seed Pet

Speeds up crop growth in a small range and can sometimes drop a Beanstalk seed when sold.

Sea Otter

B Tier

Plant Growth Pet

Waters plants at different times to speed up growth, but since most crops grow pretty quickly, it mostly helps when you’re short on time or growing slower plants.

Owl

B Tier

XP Booster

Shares the same abilities as Blood Owl and Night Owl, but it's not that solid.

Green Bean

B Tier

Harvest Related

Sometimes sacrifices a random Beanstalk fruit to instantly grow another plant in your garden, giving it a fruit size bonus .

Caterpillar

B Tier

Plant Growth Pet

Makes leafy plants grow faster (Beanstalk, Corn, Pepper, Eggplant, etc.), but there are other crops that aren’t leafy.

Shroomie

B Tier

Plant Growth Pet

Causes fungus-type plants in your garden to grow larger, like Mushrooms, Duskpuff, Horned Dinoshroom, etc.

Cardinal

B Tier

Plant Growth Pet

Makes all magic-type plants (e.g., Fairy event plants) grow 1.6x faster.

Ladybug

B Tier

Plant Growth Pet

Speeds up all flower-type crops by 1.6x , making Tranquil Bloom, Moon Blossom, Poseidon Plant, and more grow faster than usual.

Cow

B Tier

Plant Growth Pet

Helps with plant growth, making it spawn fruits real quick (about 1.12 times faster).

Woodpecker

B Tier

Plant Growth Pet

Lets wood-type plants duplicate. Best used in events where these crops need to be submitted.

Elk

B Tier

Fruit Duplicator

Berry fruits have a 2% chance to remain after harvest.

Toucan

B Tier

Plant Growth & Mutation

Allows your Tropical Plants (Mango, Dragon Fruit, Coconut, Cacao, and Watermelon) to mature quickly and gain a variant with a 1.18% chance.

Flamingo

B Tier

Plant Growth Pet

Good for overall plant and fruit growth, but not as effective as the Triceratops.

Robin

B Tier

Player Size

A playful new pet that shrinks your avatar’s height , giving it a cute look.

Chimpanzee

C Tier

Resource Pet

Automatically sells random crops from your farm, with a 2.38% chance of skipping plants. Not the best pick if you’re stacking mutations on crops.

Pack Bee

C Tier

Inventory Pet

Expands your inventory slots , letting you carry more fruits, pets, and seeds while the critter is on your plot.

Iguana

C Tier

Mutation Pet

Removes the Frozen mutation from plants, changing it to either Chilled or Wet.

Hedgehog

C Tier

Plant Growth & Variant

A less powerful version of the Blood Hedgehog.

Maneki-neko

C Tier

Resource Pet

Refunds fruits every two minutes when you sell them. The ability lasts for 10 seconds.

Iguanodon

C Tier

Aging Pet

A special pet that helps age all your active dinos by transferring XP to them.

Corrupted Kodama

C Tier

Mutation Pet

Provides Corrupt mutated fruits (20x multiplier).

Kodama

C Tier

Mutation Pet

It turns your picked fruits into Tranquil (20x value).

Pixie

C Tier

Float + Plant Growth Pet

Pixie can let you and nearby players levitate by jumping in its circle (not always guaranteed) and speeds up nearby fruit growth by 30s.

Jackalope

C Tier

Mutation Pet

Turns nearby fruits into a Sandy variant worth 3x their value every 99.3 seconds, with a 15.64% chance.

Glimmering Sprite

C Tier

Mutation Pet

Mutates your fruits with Glimmering Mutation (2x mutation) .

Squirrel

C Tier

Reclaimer & XP Booster

Might save a single use of your Reclaimer and gain some experience points per second.

Peacock

C Tier

Cooldown Pet

Reduces the cooldown of all nearby critters by 61 seconds every 9.58 minutes.

Grey Mouse

C Tier

Jump Height & XP Booster

A less effective version of Brown Mouse .

Monkey

C Tier

Resource Pet

Similar to Silver Monkey, just not as powerful.

Rooster

C Tier

Hatch Related

Only raises egg hatching speed by 20%.

Bee

C Tier

Mutation Pet

Produces Pollinated fruits , but it's slower than Honey Bee (24.45 minutes).

Frog

C Tier

Plant Growth Pet

Works like Echo Frog , but takes longer to activate its ability.

Chicken

C Tier

Hatch Related

Helps a little with egg hatching (boosts speed by 10%).

Bagel Bunny

C Tier

Crop Value Booster

Devours a carrot and increases its selling price by 5x.

Orange Tabby

C Tier

Size Booster

Makes crops 1.5x bigger in size and weight , which increases their value.

Cat

C Tier

Size Booster

Pretty much does the same thing as Orange Tabby .

Seagull

C Tier

Seed Pet

Raise the chance of getting free seeds through Lucky Harvest, but the odds are still low. A Reclaimer is the more reliable choice.

Salmon

C Tier

XP pet

Allows other Salmon pets to gain experience points when they are active on your plot.

Nihonzaru

D Tier

Passive Booster

If there’s a Hot Spring on your plot, Nihonzaru hops in for a bath and basically does nothing.

Black Bunny

D Tier

Crop Value Booster

Increases a carrot's selling value by 1.5x, but carrots aren't a top money-maker.

Bunny

D Tier

Crop Value Booster

Just a regular bunny that eats carrots and bumps up their selling value by 1.5x.

Best Pets in Grow a Garden

Most animals in Grow a Garden are super helpful, but a few of them stand out from the pack:

  • Kitsuni has outshined all other fruit-stealing critters in Grow a Garden . It’s even better than Raccoon because not only can it steal a plant for you like Candy Blossom, but it also raises that plant’s value by 15x or even 90x before giving it to you.
  • Dragonfly and Butterfly are also OP critters since they give you the two most valuable variants in the game: Gold and Rainbow. These can blow up your plant's stacking bonus, taking their value from just a few million to literal billions.
  • Disco Bee and Space Squirrel can give you Disco and Voidtouched plants, which were once limited to rare Disco and Blackhole events. These mutated variants sell for 125x and 135x their original value.
  • Chinchilla and Swan are among the best critters in Grow a Garden since they can act as duplicate pets. The Octopus copies traits from your active pets, while the Swan copies from a neighbor’s farm.
  • Fennec Fox, T-Rex, and Spinosaurus are must-haves for mutations. One of the main differences is that the fox can steal mutations from neighboring farms (even Dawnbound, Plasma, and Voidtouched), while the dinosaurs can clone them from your own farm. Spinosaurus is especially useful when you want to stack mutations on your favorite fruits.
  • The top pets from the Ghoul Garden Event in Grow a Garden are obviously Headless Horseman, Bone Dog, and Spider (Mega or Titanic). To progress faster and earn more Candy Corn, Ghost Bear is also an important one to keep in your garden.
